scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 29 pharmacy and medicine bottles of various sizes produced or used by Brooklyn druggists, pharmacies, and pharmaceutical manufacturing companies, dating from around 1880 to 1920.

Pharmacies and druggists: Abraham and Straus; Thomas A. Beard (Lee Avenue and Rutledge Street); Le Roy Braswell, The Rexall Store (89 7th Avenue); William Buderus (90 Utica Avenue; 1726 Fulton Street); S. Chichester (357 Myrtle Avenue); Louis Crome, pharmacist (East 92nd Street, Canarsie); Davidson & Bulkley Pharmacy - Brooklyn Heights (84 Montague Street); Fifth Avenue Drug Company (Limited) (522 5th Avenue); William H. Hanson, pharmacist; J. L. House, druggist; F.A. Kattman, pharmacist; R.C. Knipe and Son (690-692 Grand Street); H.W. Koch, pharmacist (3rd Avenue and 74th Street); Frederick Loeser & Co.; Neergaard's Pharmacy (225 5th Avenue); Parrish; L. T. Perkins, pharmacist (19 Greene Avenue); Reid & Snyder, prescription experts (740 Flatbush Avenue); Riker's Drug Stores; D.H. Starr (350 7th Avenue, corner 10th Street); and R.H. Thayer, druggist (33 Atlantic Avenue);

Pharmaceutical and medicinal products: Chas. Dennin - Rheumatism medicine; F. Ad. Richter & Co., Inc. (Berry Street and South Fifth Street) - Loxol Pain Expeller; Fougera's Eau Angelique tooth wash; Lyon Manufacturing Company - Hagan's Magnolia Balm (1919); Lyon Manufacturing Company - Mexican mustang liniment; and J. A. Vaughan - Lister's antiseptic liniment.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Edward R. Squibb collection (2008.021) contains additional material related to the Brooklyn pharmaceutical industry of the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
